version_description:
• Improved performance for sending iPhone battery information to Apple Watch

• Fixed a bug that would show the wrong Apple Watch charging state on iPhone

• Added another larger tip option

• Other minor improvements
• Added a guide with tips to keep Juice Watch running and updating smoothly
• This update attempts to fix a background crash on Apple Watch that could stop regular updates of the complication and iPhone app
• This update attempts to fix an issue that could stop regular updates of the complication and iPhone app

• The complication gauge color now matches the green color of the system Battery complication when the level is above 20% on supported watch faces

• This update attempts to further improve reliability of updates to the complication and iPhone app from Apple Watch

• Added a "Both" option to show Apple Watch level for the gauge and number on the complication (this can be useful if you want to see only your Apple Watch level on the complication, but want to encourage the app to update frequently by having the complication installed)

• Added a graphic to explain the complication configuration in the iPhone app

• Fixed a typo in the user guide

• Improved complication colors: Fixed a bug where the complication text color would match the gauge on some complication styles, even when the text and gauge were showing different device levels. Text will now always show as white (to match the system Battery complication) when the number and gauge are both showing the same device's level. When showing two different device levels, the text will be white unless the level of the device it represents is below 20%, when the text will turn red.

• Added support for the Utilitarian Small Flat complication, which is used for the Above Time complication on the Photos face, among other places

• Added a message in the iPhone app when Background App Refresh is disabled, since it is required for Juice Watch to function normally

• Updated the green color on the complication to better match green color of the system Battery complication
• Now you can customize the Apple Watch charge notification level from the default 90% level: choose any threshold from 50 to 95%

• Added an option to show a number on the gauge on supported complications, so you can now see the numerical level of both the watch and phone on the same complication

• Attempted to fix some background crashes and improve the overall reliability of syncing between Apple Watch and iPhone

• Added another option for an even larger tip if you REALLY like the app

• Improved the explanation of the number on complication gauge
• Added another tip option
• Updated User Guide to make it more consistent, less wordy, and match current set of features
• Fixed an issue that would prevent Apple Watch battery level from updating on complication when iPhone was not connected

• Adds the much-requested iPhone battery charged notification: get a notification on iPhone (and Apple Watch, depending on your notification settings) when iPhone is charged to at least 80% (or anywhere in the 50–95% range, depending on the level you choose)

• Snooze Notifications: You can now snooze a notification for 15 minutes, 30 minutes, or 1 hour

• App Icon Badge: See the most recent Apple Watch battery level on the Juice Watch iPhone app icon with an optional badge (and choose whether you want to see this only when Apple Watch is charging, or all the time)
• Alternate App Icon: you can now choose an alternate, dark version of the app icon
• Fixed an issue that prevented the iPhone charged notification from working normally

• Improves reliability

• You can now see what version number you have in the app, and whether there is an update available
• Minor reliability and usability improvements
• Improves error handling to provide better feedback when there are problems

• Optionally see charging indicators on supported complications

• Created more sections of settings to indicate which options are supported on which types of complications

• Added text in the iPhone app to show which complication you currently have enabled, if any

• Added a button to share the app with friends

• The iPhone app now shows the name of the currently-paired Apple Watch

• Improved reliability

• Added low battery notifications

• Added support to automatically switch between multiple Apple Watches paired with the same iPhone

• Improved notification approval workflow

• Improved reliability and data synchronization
• Attempted to fix a common crash on Apple Watch

• Added option to change the notification sound

• Improved notification permissions workflow

• Improved syncing reliability
• Improvements to syncing system to keep iPhone and Apple Watch up to date

• Fixed an issue that would show "unknown" in the iPhone app instead of the series number of the paired Apple Watch

• Improved syncing and performance

• Updated charging indicator to work with more types of complications

• Added white complication color support to more types of complications

• Fixed layout issues on devices with larger text size settings
• Added back support for the complication Utilitarian Small Flat template to bring back support to more watch faces
• Updated layout to re-organize settings and make the main screen cleaner
• Added options to set iPhone and Apple Watch battery charged notifications above 95%
• Re-grouped some of the main screen to make the layout cleaner
• Made improvements to in-app purchase system

• Added another notification sound option

• Fixed issues with the share button
